page.title: 09HISTORY AND LEGEND
page.content: The area has long been settled and has many associations with the past. {St. Fillan,}a Celtic monk is said to have performed miracles. Holy wells,like that of St.Peter, north of Houston,were once visited by the sick. Nearby stood the{Barochan}Cross,now in Paisley Abbey. It is a 10th century sculpture with inscriptions of a phoenix,pelican and lamb. {Craigends House}was the home of the {Cunninghame}family who feuded with other powerful landowners. In 1553 the Laird of Craigends was murdered by friends of the Semples of Lochwinnoch. The assailants were executed.Manor houses still in use are Barochan House and{Houston House,the latter an imposing building standing in a large wooded estate. Its tall turrets remind people of the areas links with medieval times.
